title: 110_s2812
content: The Medicare Telehealth Improvement Act of 2008, also known as the Act, includes provisions such as an increase in the types of originating sites and expansion of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services. It aims to improve the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Act includes provisions to increase the types of originating sites for telehealth services, such as skilled nursing facilities, renal dialysis facilities, community mental health centers, qualified community programs, county mental health clinics, and any other site with a telecommunications system. The Act expands originating sites for telehealth services to include skilled nursing facilities, renal dialysis facilities, community mental health centers, qualified community programs, county mental health clinics, and any other site with a telecommunications system. No facility fee is required for certain originating sites. No facility fee is required for certain originating sites under the amendments made by this section, effective 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act. Expansion of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services. Expansion of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services. Amendment to Section 1834(m) of the Social Security Act to broaden the definition of a practitioner to include physical therapists, occupational therapists, and qualified speech-language pathologists. The amendment expands the list of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services to include physical therapists, occupational therapists, qualified speech-language pathologists, audiologists, certified providers, and other individuals or entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The effective date for these changes is 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The amendment expands the list of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services, including physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech-language pathologists, audiologists, certified providers, and others as deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The effective date for these changes is 90 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. IMPROVEMENT OF PROCESS FOR UPDATING THE LIST OF TELEHEALTH SERVICES. The amendment to the Social Security Act requires the Secretary to consider recommendations from the Telehealth Advisory Committee when adding or removing services. If a recommendation is not implemented, the Secretary must provide a reason in the Federal Register. A Telehealth Advisory Committee will be established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Telehealth Advisory Committee will be established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make recommendations on adding or removing services for authorized payment under the Social Security Act. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, consists of 7 members appointed based on specific criteria, including 5 practicing physicians and 2 non-physician health care providers. Members must have prior experience in the practice of healthcare. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, consists of 7 members appointed based on specific criteria. Members must have prior experience in telemedicine or telehealth services, represent a balance of specialties and geographic regions, and include both practicing physicians and non-physician health care providers. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, established by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, consists of 7 members appointed based on specific criteria. Members must have experience in telemedicine or telehealth services, represent a balance of specialties and regions, and consider stakeholder recommendations. The Advisory Committee meets twice a year and is not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Members serve terms specified by the Secretary. The Telehealth Advisory Committee meets twice a year and may meet at other times as needed. It is not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act, and the Secretary can establish it without limitations on the number of advisory committees.
